item.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2864) to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the Secretary of the Army to construct various projects for improvements to rivers and harbors of the United States, and for other purposes.

item.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Senate insists on its amendment, agrees to request for a conference, appoints conferees Inhofe; Warner; Bond; Voinovich; Chafee; Murkowski; Vitter; Jeffords; Baucus; Lieberman; Boxer; Carper. (consideration: CR S9734-9735)
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House requests a conference.

The Speaker appointed conferees - from the Committee on Resources for consideration of secs. 2017, 2020, 2025, and 2027 of the House bill, and secs. 3019, 5007, and 5008 of the Senate amendment, and modifications committed to conference: Pombo, Musgrave, and Kind.

The Speaker appointed conferees - from the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure for consideration of the House bill and the Senate amendment, and modifications committed to conference: Young (AK), Duncan, Baker, Miller, Gary, Brown (SC), Boozman, Oberstar, Johnson, E. B., Costello, and Bishop (NY).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion that the House instruct conferees Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 340 - 79 (Roll no. 447). (consideration: CR H6596-6597)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on the Melancon motion to instruct conferees on H.R. 2864, the Chair put the question on the adoption of the motion and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Melancon demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the motion until Thursday, September 14, 2006.
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H6505)

DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the Melancon motion to instruct conferees on H.R. 2864. The instructions contained in the motion seek to require the managers on the part of the House to agree to provisions that will provide protection to communities located in the coastal area of Louisiana and Mississippi from the storm surge of a category 5 hurricane.
Mr. Melancon moved that the House instruct conferees. (consideration: CR H6504; text: CR H6504)
On motion that the House disagree to the Senate amendment, and request a conference Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Duncan asked unanimous consent that the House disagree to the Senate amendment, and request a conference. (consideration: CR H6504-6505)
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
See also S. 728.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote. (text: CR S7858-7894)

Senate struck all after the Enacting Clause and substituted the language of S. 728 amended.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S7858-7894)
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 166.

The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule. (consideration: CR H5880)
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 2864.

UNFINISHED BUSINESS - The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question of adoption of the amendments which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
DEBATE - Pursuant to H. Res. 346, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Kind amendment.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on the Flake amendment, the Chair put the question on adoption of the amendment and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Mr. Flake demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the amendment until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - Pursuant to H. Res. 346, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Flake amendment.

Mr. Rohrabacher demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of the amendment until later in the legislative day.

GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 2864.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Henry Bonilla to act as Chairman of the Committee.

item.title: H.R. 2864, Water Resources Development Act of 2005
